build().Description: Combine all of the options that have been set by both this builder and the wrapped @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder_E@ object and return a new @B_android#app#Notification_E@ object.

WearableNotifications.Builder(android.co.Description: Construct a builder to be used for adding wearable extensions to notifications. Both the wrapped builder (accessible via @B_android#preview#support#wearable#notifications#WearableNotifications#Builder#getCompatBuilder_E@) and this builder can be used simultaneously, but the build() method from this object must be called in the end. Always post notifications to the notification system with the NotificationManagerCompat.notify(...) methods instead of the NotificationManager.notify(...) methods.

Parameters: the notification to add as another page
addPage(android.app.Notification).Description: Add an additional page of content to display with this notification. The current notification forms the first page, and pages added using this function form subsequent pages. This field can be used to separate a notification into multiple sections.

Parameters: icon to display for the content action.
Optional subtext to display with the big action icon.
setBigActionIcon(int, java.lang.CharSequ.Description: Add a big action display to this notification. Big actions show a hint to users about the action taken when the content intent is triggered.
setBigActionIcon(int, java.lang.CharSequ.FullName: public WearableNotifications.Builder setBigActionIcon (int icon, CharSequence subtext)

Parameters: true to hide the icon, false otherwise.
setHintHideIcon(boolean).Description: Set a hint that this notification's icon should not be displayed.

getExtras().Description: Get the current metadata Bundle used by this Builder, creating a new one as necessary. The returned Bundle is shared with this Builder.

Parameters: the action to add to this notification
addAction(android.preview.support.wearab.Description: Add an action to this notification. Actions are typically displayed by the system as a button adjacent to the notification content. This method accepts @B_android#preview#support#wearable#notifications#WearableNotifications#Action_E@ extension wrappers. Actions added by this function are appended when @B_android#preview#support#wearable#notifications#WearableNotifications#Builder#build_E@ is called.

getCompatBuilder().Description: Return the @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder_E@ being wrapped by this object.

WearableNotifications.Builder(android.su.Description: Construct a builder to be used for adding wearable extensions to notifications to a @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder_E@. Both the wrapped builder and this builder can be used simultaneously, but the build() method from this object must be called in the end. Always post notifications to the notification system with the NotificationManagerCompat.notify(...) methods instead of the NotificationManager.notify(...) methods.

Parameters: The group key of the group. Unique within a package.
setGroup(java.lang.String).Description: Set this notification to be part of a group of notifications sharing the same key. Grouped notifications may display in a cluster or stack on devices which support such rendering. Use the default ordering within a group.

addPages(java.util.Collection<android.ap.Description: Add additional pages of content to display with this notification. The current notification forms the first page, and pages added using this function form subsequent pages. This field can be used to separate a notification into multiple sections.

Parameters: icon to display for the content action.
setBigActionIcon(int).Description: Add a big action display to this notification. Big actions show a hint to users about the action taken when the content intent is triggered.

Parameters: a @B_android#preview#support#wearable#notifications#RemoteInput_E@ object to obtain a user response
addRemoteInputForContentIntent(android.p.Description: Adds a @B_android#preview#support#wearable#notifications#RemoteInput_E@ for the content intent. The collected data will be overlayed onto the content intent.

setMinPriority().Description: Set the priority of this notification to be minimum priority level (@B_android#app#Notification#PRIORITY_MIN_E@). When set via WearableNotifications, these minimum priority notifications will bypass the notification manager on platforms that do not support ambient level notifications.

Parameters: The group key of the group. Unique within a package.

The 0-indexed sort order within the group. Can also be set to the sentinel value @B_android#preview#support#wearable#notifications#WearableNotifications#GROUP_ORDER_SUMMARY_E@ to mark this notification as being the group summary.
setGroup(java.lang.String, int).Description: Set this notification to be part of a group of notifications sharing the same key. Grouped notifications may display in a cluster or stack on devices which support such rendering.
setGroup(java.lang.String, int).FullName: public WearableNotifications.Builder setGroup (String groupKey, int groupOrder)

Parameters: true to keep the notification on this device, false otherwise. Default value is false.
setLocalOnly(boolean).Description: Set whether or not this notification is only relevant to the current device. Some notifications can be bridged to other devices for remote display. This hint can be set to recommend this notification not be bridged.

ClassDesc: Builder class that wraps a @B_android#support#v4#app#NotificationCompat#Builder_E@ to add wearable extensions for a notification. You can chain the "set" methods for this builder in any order, but you must call the @B_android#preview#support#wearable#notifications#WearableNotifications#Builder#build_E@ method last to build the final notification.
